p: LIF (leukemia inhibitory factor) is one of the important cytokines to protect the respiratory system and promote lung homeostasis during viral infections [ 67, 68]. This cytokine modulates severe adverse events during ARDS [ 67]. Up to now, there is no study investigating the role of LIF in SARS-CoV-2 infection. However, in respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) model, it has been shown that overexpression of LIF enhanced the recovery of lungs during pneumonia. Neutralization of the LIF induced alveolar damage and chemokine secretion [ 69]. According to these data, LIF might also have protective effects in SARS-CoV-2 infection.
